intro: Tylophora kenejiana, commonly known as the Keneji tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds with silky hairs, aiding in wind dispersal. Tylophora kenejiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
